description: best replacement for mspaint!
Some UI decisions are strange (move selection and adjust selection are two different buttons on the toolbar?) but at least I don't want to uninstall it immediately
Familiar to a former user of paint.net, but the complete inability to resize anything other than the entire image makes it virtually useless for image editing.
I wanted paint.net on linux, this is it. the layout is a tiny bit different but everything is here.
I use it for simple resize, crop or create new from clipbord. Some times I add the markers to the existing screenshots. It is betwean viewer and fullfunctional picture eritor. Works well for me.

Application stores all changes made to in image in memory, such that a mere 30 edits to an image can cause the program's ram usage to skyrocket to 10 gigabytes or more. Avoid this program at all costs. It will crash your computer.
I've installed this before, and it definately does not use 1GB of space as the listing here says?

description: simple, easy, awesome
just learn a thing or two from microsoft paint
Works fine in Arch Linux, those giving 1 star reviews must have a very specific distro issue not related to the app itself. Simple and works as intented, the UI has some space for improvement.
it is good but there are some that needed to fix with it
summary: does'nt paste the layers and cut it

description: I've been using this for a few years on Arch, a nice lightweight easy alternative to GIMP for doing more basic image tasks

Simple editor for simple needs. Loads quickly and goes away when you're done. Doesn't feel like you're trying to steer and oil tanker like some other apps or that it's only for the little kiddie winks.
summary: Does what I needed it to. Draw red lines around stuff

description: Installed flatpak which worked right out of the box. Performs the simple tasks I need admirably. Its a nice alternative to complex image editors.
Of those simplistic image editors, Pinta does its job very nicely. All the basic functions for small tweaks are there. Free and open source too.
Great app for simple editing of images, an MS Paint alternative. Look and feel is a bit dated though.

I was a huge fan of Paint.net on Windows. So much so that I considered not going to Linux just so I'd have that app. I eventually just decided to use Paint.net on GNOME boxes, but I found this today and I love it. Same quality as Paint.net on Windows, but could use a bit more polish.
Intuitive and useful application.
it's very easy to use it's pretty close to paint.net so it's very easy to use but the big problem with this program is how often it crashes if it weren't for that it'd be a really good program
Whilst I would recommend this app, numerous bugs are still present. It's an improvement over the old one; however there's still lots of work to be done.

description: I used Pinta earlier without any major issues, and decided to install it again after a couple of years to have a quick annotation tool. Version 1.7, installed from Snap. It appeared to be awfully slow and unresponsive (at least with selection, rectangle and text tools) and also buggy (at least with the text tool). Uninstalled almost instantly and went back to heavier but stable Gimp.
The best alternative to MS paint on gnu/linux
There are better options.
It loads fasts and does what I need. No crazy ui scaling and 20 seconds to load.
summary: A simple to use image editor

description: perfect when you want to save and/or crop screenshots

Works fine for me, Ubuntu 20.04.3

To all that say it crashed, please mention your OS. It would be very helpful.

I have been looking for a simple app to edit images, crop, re-size and add annotations and minimum tweaks here and there. This was the answer!!
Thanks to the developer
other one crashing download this
Based on Paint.Net
It makes screenshot drawing easier
Pinta 2.0 was a major release in December 2021 porting the code to GTK3. I love Pinta as a cross-platform app for quick image edits without having to launch other image editing software.
summary: Love it again since Pinta 2.0 release!

description: It will do the basic image editing pretty well. I liked its simplicity.

Latest version is a massive step up.

However, I'm running a 4K monitor with a dark theme and there are still issues with tiny icons and theming on some text.

But this is not to detract. Pinta fits the gap between a too basic editor and the frightening monstrosities that are Gimp and Krita. A middle-ground image editor like this is essential on Linux.

Credit to the author -- thank you.

This is really quite a nice program and it works fine on Kubuntu. The only issue I noticed with this snap is that the dashed lines don't work in the application. Of the various dashed lines that you are supposed to be able to draw only two worked for me and only randomly. Otherwise it is a very nice little program that I would like to continue to use. Also if I could add old photoshop filters and additonal brushes that would be cool. Perhaps the developers could create a tool that converts brushes for other programs to use in this application. A preference setting where you could make the tools a bit larger for those of us that need glasses would also be great.
how do you even resize an image in a selection?

description: I could use it only once!

A lot of recent reviews says the app doesn't launch or crashes. At least on Fedora 36 flatpak install, it works well. No crashes so far. It's an easy to use, basic editor with the most common features easy to find. When pasting an screenshot, it's smart enough to ask to resize the canvas.

 Doesn't have a recent files open option, but the normal Open file dialog has Recents. Image cropping is not 100% obvious.

description: Version 2.0.2 works very well, installed via flatpak. Very much paint.net on windows. Just what is needed for general use.
summary: Great app very much like paint.net on windows

description:
Last version I had was 1.7 and the text selection toolbar was messed up and very hard to use. I've been using this for years, probably since version 1.2 or so. 1.7 worked OK, best release was on a developer repository. Then, no crashes!
Version 2.0.2 has a new toolbox for selection tools that I don't particularly like (a single row down the side, then color selector at the bottom) instead of the classic 1.6 or 1.7 toolboxes (double rows along side only.) 
I think 2.0.1 was actually a better release but is unavailable unless you build it yourself.
Version 2.0.2 is available in Flatpak, easy to install and run, but if you want it in your menus you have to manually put it there. And, maybe because it's Flatpak, the save as dialog opens at some weird location by default, you'll have to be sure to manually select your folder to save in! Also I noticed the program freezes if you try to save more than once, then close. But a dialog "force quit" pops up, so I guess that's the workaround.
ssss ss good!!
Simple yet efficient
I use Pinta to do what I used to do with Paint under Windows. Works perfectly for me.
Easy like paint.net
Good lightweight app to quickly edits the screenshots I need to share with the team
summary: A simple way to edit screenshots

As the summary says, its a great app but it keeps on crashing... Could you do something about it?

32GB RAM
512 SSD M.2
Debian 11
summary: Its cool but makes my Debian 11 freeze and crash

description: At first I liked the simplicity and the fact that it has layers and different blending modes for them, but I've encountered quite a few glitches like UI component duplication and values starting to change on their own in just the first half an hour of usage. It seems unfinished and buggy to me.
Exactly the type of simple image editor I was looking for.
I love this app. Thanks to whoever made it!
Misses basic features like resizing selection. Very poor flow. Extremely buggy and broken. Crashed mid usage. Completely useless.
summary: Crashed in middle of edits, didnt save

description: I want to add effects, but the adjustment controls window that pops up is in the way of what I need to see. When I try to move the controls window the entire application window moves, while the controls window maintains it's relative position and still covers the same part of the image I need to see.
Just what I need
Does just what I need, very intuitive
Need some documentation, it is in no way intuitively what any of the buttons does.
Works perfect with Wayland only mode, small size and native support of last stable GNOME env.

It gets the job done when you need something simple, but it doesn't have a dark mode or option to follow the system theme at least not for every DE. It is blindingly white if you use at night you will damage your eyes.

I wanted to collate 2 images vertically, something I can do with Paint on Windows easily, which I read this was the equivalent of. Not only was it not very intuitive, there was 3 bugs and I didn't manage to do it.

Unless you like to be a beta-tester, don't install this.

I have a workflow for work where I write a lot on screenshots, while I could use other tools for this purpose as well, I always had to change the defaults to have good looking stuff drawn on screenshots.

Pinta nails my previous workflow and the UI behaves well with adw-gtk3 theme.

Unstable, Confusing icons, bad user interface

There's no obvious way to preserve layers, at first, you must select OpenRaster on your own at the very bottom of the list. Saving in the archaic JPEG by default is ridiculous. 

Transparent gradients either 1. don't work, or 2. crash the program.

The program crashes with 0 messages, and doesn't autosave, so good luck if you didn't save yourself every 5 seconds.

Doing stuff like using CTRL+A to select doesn't actually select the tool, so you can easily get confused when you want to CTRL+A+Delete to just delete your current work.

Tools are hidden if they overflow under an overflow button, other than just letting you detatch the tool interface or widen it yourself to 2 rows. Things that should be checkboxes are dropdowns, such as AntiAliasing. There are multiple shape tools other than just a single shape tool, so you can't make a rectangle and decide later that actually you want it rounded.

This is just a really basic paint program, that tries to be more advanced, but fails miserably at every step.
summary: If you're looking for a Paint.Net replacement, look elsewhere

description: Works perfectly, and is full of features. Super useful. Great job!
Pinta has gotten to a point being very useful quick photo editing solution. It now also has the magic wand.
summary: Snap version (2.1.1) works great! Avoid the 1.6 version (deb)

description: I needed to do something simple, just resize the canvas to 110%. It crashed multiple times when I tried doing this. The crash was easily re-creatable. Open image, resize canvas to 110%. Finally got it to work by reducing image to 90% then increasing the canvas to 110%. I'm using a fresh Ubuntu 22.04 so I should expect this to work better than it was at the time... I probably will have to look for an alternative here.

Former windows user here, I was looking for an alternative to 
MSpaint, and this is almost perfect! The only real difference I 
see is the tool bar is on the left side, rather than the top, but it
has every tool mspaint has! Plus a few extras. I have the snap
version of Pinta.

It needs a dark mode option either some kinda a toggle or in quick settings it's blinding when used in a dark room. It would be even better if the default white is dropped and replaced with dark as default since most prefer that way.

Everything is very intuitive, with a well organized interface and just the right amount of tools to do what you want, without having redundant tools. The only downside the comes to mind is the lack of a dark theme.
summary: One of my favorites- very intuitive

description: decent replacement for paint.net but needs a dark mode toggle that doesnt rely on the host system. Fedora package is outdated, I'm not sure about other distros but you should use the flatpak version as it's the most up to date version of pinta.
One of my favorite image apps. Simple, fast and powerfull. Runs great on the deck !
I've uninstalled the program already.
It's simple and functional! Love it!

description: This software is simple, but very useful. Congratulations!

I use it for editing screenshots: add shapes on image, comments.
summary: Nice tool, looks like PBrush in Windows OS

description: Works as expected-

There is only 1 group of people who should ever use this program. People coming from windows who used Paint.Net a lot before coming to Linux but who can't run Windows 7 or later threw a VM on there computer. No one else. If you can’t run Paint.Net threw a VM consider dual booting a Windows OS or having a second windows computer, but if you can't or don’t want to then sadly Pinta is the closest thing to Paint.Net available on Linux as Paint.Net is not Linux compatible, not even threw Wine.

The Flatpack version of of Pinta is the most up to date but has some somewhat functionality (like Add-in support witch is needed to enable basic functionality like generating a pixel grid or PDN [Paint.Net's native file format] support) disabled because the dev team is unable to fix bugs related to those functionalitys in a reasonable time-frame, the Fedora RPM version of Pinta wile an older version has these functionalitys in tact. However wile usable both versions have bugs that will likely necessitate installing both versions and flip flopping between them to get around bugs that arrant present in the other version. If the program becomes unresponsive wait for a few minutes before trying to terminate it. On top of this if you use this program make sure to save regularly as on top of stalling out sometimes the program also likes to randomly crash from time to time.

When the program is working however... it's mostly usable... most things you can do in Paint.Net can be done in Pinta... but with more difficulty and time in most cases.
crashes when saving after resizing canvas after rescaling image

Color picker is giving incorrect color on Ubuntu 20.04. Green (0,255,0) is shown way darker in color picker as it dims image when you open Custom color window. .Otherwise, useful tool, but can crash once in a while.

Please check the Help | About window. It should be 2.1.1. If it is not, then you are using few years outdated veresion.

Please try using snap or flatpak version which are up to date.
summary: For those that Pinta is crashing

description:
Cound not use as the icons were barely visible on my high def screen.
Might be some setting to change but I ain't gonna bother.
Passt besser zur Gnome Designphilosophie und braucht viel weniger Platz als kolorpaint. Gehört einfach in den Werkzeugkasten. Screenshots verabreiten etc. Einfach zu bedienen. Danke.

Warum Einfach, wenn es Umständlich auch geht. Du kannst nichts richtig Ausschneiden. Wenn du was einfügst musst du dir genau überlegen wo du das einfügst. Wenn du weiteres einfügst, sitzt das erste bereits fest und du kannst nichts verändern. Ich habe ein uraltes Photoimpacht Programm, welches schon besser funktioniert als das. Diese Programm ist das Grauen, weil auch bei ausgefallenen Schriftgestaltungen, z.Bsp. für die Webseite, musst du Online auf eine einen Anbieter wechseln.
summary: Das schlechteste Program seit es Fotobearbeitung gibt

description: Grundlegende Funktion i.O. konnte keine Fehler feststellen.
Zeitverschwendung
Großartiges Programm, klare Empfehlung!

Lo conoci, pensando en un reemplazo para paint.net, es muy similar, pero no tiene todas las funciones, es un poco engorroso tratar de cambiar el tamaño de la imagen, pero yo usando una laptop del 2016 con un i3 y graficos integrados no se cuelga ni traba hace su trabajo y ya, lo recomendaria para cosas simples y si quieres una alternativa a paint.net

description: Se tiene que repetir el proceso para que las líneas no aparezcan. Casi está intuitivo. El rectángulo de selección no se quita ni con la tecla "escape" y si haces click en otra área tampoco se quita la selección. No funciona con la tecla "ctrl" y el puntero del ratón a la vez para arrastrar el texto seleccionado, tienes que cortar o copiar luego soltar luego mover el puntero del ratón encima y arrastrar la selección allí se pintan las líneas encima y al lado y la selección no se quita ¿podrían mejorar igual o mejor que el Paint del Windows, por favor?
summary: Algunos caracteres los pega con unas líneas encima y al lado

description: Consume 1.5G de memoria para editar una captura de pantalla.
Es de los pocos que son simple de usar y tiene las funciones esenciales

Gimp was to complicated, Krita too.
Pinta is perfect, nice UX and sleek UI. Thanks!

Après GIMP, le plus complet et le plus efficace, Krita qui a essayé de faire aussi bien et plus simple, voici enfin un logiciel simple et efficace, inutile de comprendre GIMP et ses subtilités, voici un logiciel facile à utiliser et donnant enfin la capacité aux débutants sous Linux / Ubuntu de pouvoir faire du dessis ou de la retouche Photo sans prendre peur. 
Très utile pour tagguer les photos de documents officiels avant leur envoi / partage avec toutes nos administrations et autres commerçants.

Для чего-то простого слишком замороченя, такой дровинг на максималках, а чего ни коснись - все как-то не с руки выходит. Но это вкусовщина. Объективно - стильно, модно, молодежно, куча всего и выглядит норм, а не как И-Мэджик. И фалэтпак кстати у меня ни разу никуда не вылетал - брехня все это
